snippet: Representative Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin blamed Democratic turnout in "urban areas" for the loss by the Republican presidential ticket last week, saying he was surprised that he and Mitt Romney did not do better in the nation's big cities.
abstract: Representative Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin blamed Democratic turnout in "urban areas" for the loss by the Republican presidential ticket last week, saying he was surprised that he and Mitt Romney did not do better in the nation's big cities.

headline.main: Ryan Surprised by Voters in 'Urban Areas'
